alert.note: Alert for Independence; Jackson; Lawrence (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 19 at 9:32AM CST until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Arkansas... Black River At Black Rock affecting Jackson, Independence and Lawrence Counties. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS. && ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Black River At Black Rock. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Farm ground along east bank begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Sunday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above action stage this morning. It is expected to rise to near 13.4 feet by early tomorrow afternoon. After that, it is expected to fluctuate...falling by Tuesday, and then rising back above action stage by early Thursday. It is possible the river could rise close to the 14 foot flood stage around late week. - Action stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Crest Time Date Black River Black Rock 14.0 11.9 Sun 9 AM 13.4 12.1 12.4 13.4 12 PM 12/20 &&
